intro: Neowerdermannia vorwerkii, commonly known as the Vorwerk's sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh conditions. Neowerdermannia vorwerkii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
